ISSUE.TITLE: "Terms of Service" popup is unreadable when the "terms" topic is having too much content (do not use popups). Configurable
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: the "read" link in "accept privacy policy" on registration page and "accept terms of service" on shopping cart / confirm order pages is currently opening the corresponding topics in a popup. While this will work fine for topics with short content, it seems most store owners are having really huge "terms of service" pages which become unreadable once they render into the small popup - the whole screen height is not enough to fit the topic content so users have to scroll inside the narrow popup window, and that's not a good user experience. I think the "read" link should redirect the user to a dedicated page instead of opening the page in a popup. Or at least the store owners to have the option to choose between a popup and dedicated page via admin setting. Pages: register, apply cendor, shopping cart, order confirmation The issue is that it can reduce conversation. Source: https://www.nopcommerce.com/boards/t/48163/terms-of-service-popup-is-unreadable-when-the-terms-topic-is-having-too-much-content.aspx
